conclusion: Use the relationship for work done in an isobaric process: W = P ΔV.
Pressure at state B and C is 0.6p0; Volume at state B is V0; Volume at state C is 0.5V0.
Calculate the change in volume: ΔV = 0.5V0 - V0 = -0.5V0.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
